intro: Hemizonia decumbens, commonly known as the decumbent hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbel inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Hemizonia decumbens is known for its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
